title: Middle mouse button to close a tab not working properly
content:
Hello.

Since some time (few months, can't really say when this started happening), the middle mouse button click on a tab stopped working as before. I will describe the expected behavior and how it (still) works on the same computer with a different browser (Chrome):

1. Hover over a tab 2. Middle-click closes a tab 3. Tabs right to the closed one move left 4. Middle-click closes a tab 5. Steps 2-4 may be repeated unless there are no tabs opened 6. Leaving the tabs bar (if any left opened) will now rearrange the remaining tabs (increase their width, etc)

Now, here is the not so great behavior I am facing in Firefox: 1. Hover over a tab 2. Middle-click closes a tab 3. Tabs right to the closed one move left 4. Middle-click rearranges the remaining tabs (increase their width, etc) 5. Middle-click closes a tab 6. Steps 2-5 may be repeated unless there are no tabs opened 7. Leaving the tabs bar (if any left opened) will now rearrange the remaining tabs (increase their width, etc), if you have left at last step 3

See, there is this extra step #4 which is really bugging me enough to actually come and ask for a support.

I am on Ubuntu 20.04, using latest version of Firefox (to date).

Many thanks!
creator: krajcar.peter

title: Cambiar el número de resultados por página
content:
Saludos compañeros.

He estado buscando en la web y en internet y los resultados que he encontrado son los que yo conocía y que ahora han desaparecido.

Hasta hace muy poco tiempo pulsando en configuración podía cambiar el número de resultados por páginas al hacer una busqueda. No se que habrá pasado pero ya no encuentro esa opción y me gustaría volver a tener esa opción y poder poner el número de páginas que yo quiero y no tener que estar pulsando en el botón inferior para que cargue otras diez pagínas.

Gracias por leer y agracezco cualquier ayuda al respecto.
creator: p1p2p3p3p2p1

title: Firefox opens M365 files in a browser tab instead of the desktop app
content:
In the SharePoint library Setting is the desktop App defined to open M365-files. Chrome, Edge and Opera, open the files in the desktop App. Not so Mozilla Firefox: with this browser, the files are opened in a Tab, instead of the desktop App. Why is that? How can I change this behaviour?

It did'nt change with marking "Ask, how files are opened or saved With kind regards, Christian

title: Mac OS Monterey Full Screen Bug
content:
Hello,

I am in the process of transitioning over to Firefox, however, for some reason it will not open in full screen. I am working with MacOS Monterey. When I go to click on green full screen button the window freezes, all the settings boxes up top disappear and the browser just totally freezes. I can't even access the 'view' menu to get out of full screen, I have to just quit the application and only use the browser in the minimized version. Please see attached screen shots of the issue I am facing. The first image shows what happens the the drop down menu after attempting to go into full screen, and the second image shows what the browser gets frozen on when I attempt to enter fullscreen. Furthermore, attempting to take any action once the full screen button has been pressed does not work except exciting the application. The window simply just stays frozen or when I click a drop down menu like view the program disappears, and the OS acts like no windows are open for Firefox. Any help would be greatly appreciated.

Thank you.
creator: benevansclifford

title: Google dot com (that URL ONLY) is SLOOOOOOOW on Firefox
content:
This has been asked here before but I've tried EVERYTHING that was offered that time, none worked.

I've used Firefox since the start, and before, I used Netscape in the 90s. I'm ready to move to another browser forever if I can't fix this. Can anyone help please?

Only thing that worked was dumb workaround of changing my Home URL from https://www.google.com (which takes about 60 seconds to do a search) to https://www.google.com/search?q=BipTunia

The second works. (Was the last search I'd done, it worked, so I used it. Works fast if I delete the word it puts in the search field, do my new search and hit Enter)


I'm on Win 10, latest version (117). Fast computer, no viruses. All other programs closed.

Search on main Google URL works fine with same Google account on other browsers, not Firefox.

I HAVE TRIED ALL OF THESE (WITH NO JOY), plus rebooting Firefox every times;

--Cleared all cache, data and cookies. --Reset Firefox --Tried Firefox in Safe Mode --Signed in with different Google account. --Signed out of Google account. --Reinstalled Firefox --Tried with and without Hardware Acceleration on --Changed default Firefox Theme
creator: feendean

title: Not getting email conformation codes
content:
I lost my authenticator app and am having to redo all of them. Since I don't have it, I had Firefox send me a conformation email so I could access my account. But they never came even after I waited and tried again. 

checked both on my mail app and on the web like the support page suggested.  I also added "accounts@firefox.com" to my whitelist and checked my spam folder.

I am logged in to the app on my phone. But that too requires me to authenticate to access account settings. Also, I am pretty sure I have my phone number added - but have not been given that option.

Any help would be great.
